stem: A 62-year-old client presents with crushing substernal chest pain and shortness of breath. Based on the documentation, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Rule out acute coronary syndrome vs. pulmonary obstruction.
Background: History of smoking and recent long-haul flight (14 hours).
Assessment: BP is dropping. Client is pale and diaphoretic. Chest pain is sharp and worse with deep breaths (pleuritic).
Recommendation: Troponin and CT scan.

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 92/58, HR 128, RR 32, T 99.2Â°F. SpO2 84% on RA.

conditionOptions.text: Massive Pulmonary Embolism (PE) with Right Heart Strain

actionOptions.text: Elevate the head of the bed and provide high-flow oxygen
Initiate IV Heparin and prepare for pulmonary angiography (CT-PE)
Encourage the client to cough and deep breathe
Place the client in a left-lateral Trendelenburg position

parameterOptions.text: Presence of right ventricular strain on EKG (S1Q3T3 pattern)
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This is a Massive Pulmonary Embolism (c2). While the chest pain and elevated Troponin suggest an MI, the S1Q3T3 pattern on the EKG and the elevated D-Dimer point to the lungs. The Right Heart is straining against the clot (Elevated BNP/Troponin). Priority actions are oxygenation optimization (a1) and immediate anticoagulation (a2). Key parameters include tracking the strain patterns (p1) and pulmonary stability (p2).
clinicalPearls: The S1Q3T3 pattern is the classic but rare EKG sign for massive PE.
Troponin rises in PE because the RIGHT ventricle is undergoing muscle damage from the pressure.
A BP of 92/58 makes this a 'Massive' PE.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking an elevated Troponin *always* means a heart attack (MI).
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Troponin is a marker of heart muscle *stress*. If the patient has low SpO2 and a massive D-Dimer, the heart is stressed because the lungs are blocked (PE).

mnemonic.title: PE-Strain
mnemonic.expansion: S-S1Q3T3. T-Troponin Up. R-Right Heart Failure. A-Angiogram (CT). I-Infarction mimic. N-NRB Mask (High O2).
